message_1: In a class of 30 students, 20 students play soccer, 15 students play basketball, and 10 students play both sports. How many students in the class do not participate in either sport?
message_2:
To find out how many students do not participate in either sport, we can use the principle of inclusion-exclusion.

Total number of students = Number of students who play soccer + Number of students who play basketball - Number of students who play both sports

Total number of students = 20 (soccer) + 15 (basketball) - 10 (both)

Total number of students = 35 - 10 = 25

Now, we know that there are 30 students in the class, and 25 of them participate in at least one sport. Therefore, the number of students who do not participate in either sport is:

30 (total students) - 25 (students who play at least one sport) = 5 students

So, 5 students in the class do not participate in either sport.
